name: Barbell Shoulder Press
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell at shoulder height with an overhand grip.

2. Engage your core and lift the barbell straight up over your head, extending your arms fully.

3. Lower the barbell behind your head, keeping your elbows slightly bent, until it nearly touches your upper back.

4. Focus on maintaining control throughout the movement, using a smooth and deliberate pace to raise and lower the barbell.

5. Avoid swinging or jerking the weight up or down.

6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

7. Rest when finished.
short_summary: Barbell shoulder press is an upper body exercise that targets the front deltoids, working to strengthen and build muscle in the shoulders.
